pet.name: Max
pet.description: Max is a beautiful 2 year old male. He is a little shy at first contact, but with time and patience he starts to come and feel us and explore more of his environment. He has had a more difficult past and he is now ready to go to a great home for life where he will be able to explore and bond in a vast environment!

pet.name: Maika
pet.description: Maika was a great riding horse in the past, but is done competing. Her owner wants to find her a great home, where she can eat all day, get lots of love, and maybe have another horse friend.

pet.name: Hammy
pet.description: Hammy is the funniest little rat. He loves ham which is why we named him Hammy. Please don't feed him ham though, we don't feed it to him, but every time someone eats ham when they are around him, he goes straight to them and will start asking for some ham.

pet.name: Risu
pet.description: Risu is a very special squirrel , she is very smart and kind , it almost feels like that she understands what you are saying. Risu loves eating alot so make sure to feed her the right amount each day . After eating , she spends her time climbing on trees and play with other animals.

pet.name: Snow
pet.description: Ever wanted to feel like a disney princess? Well adopt this cute litle bunny and you can! He is super energetic and very loving. He is obsessed with carrots, feed him a carrot and he will love you forever. You will be so happy with this little guy.

pet.name: Poseidon
pet.description: We got Poseidon from a farmer that went bankrupt and sold his farm. He wanted to make sure that his animals would end up in a caring home and live out their ramaining years on a farm. He's got some personality this one! You will never be bored with him around.

pet.name: Leonardo
pet.description: We got Leonardo from a family who's kids weren't careful with him. He is awfuly adorable but very fragile because he is so small. A person that has experience with raising reptiles is preffered. Leonardo can't wait to find his forever home!

pet.name: Donald
pet.description: Donald is the cutest little ball of fur. He needs a responsible owner! Baby chicks need a lot of care and monitoring, and very specific conditions. We want to find the best farm for him.

pet.name: Lenny
pet.description: Lenny was sadly given up by his owner to go into a nursing home. He is a very affectionate boy, and hopes to find a new home very soon. He is housebroken, and would love a new family. At the time, Lenny is heartworm positive, but will have his treatment provided by us and will be healthy again! Your new pet will require a refresher in house-training. K-9 Lifesavers strongly recommends all new adopters enroll their new pet into obedience training. This provides for an easier transition into a new home, ensures the dog remains well socialized, and helps form a bond between the dog and the new family.

pet.name: Mitch
pet.description: Mitch is a sweet-tempered 12 year old boy who loves to be around his people. He is happiest when curled up in a lap or snuggled close under the covers. Mitch is a quiet dog who gets along well with people and other dogs. He doesn’t hear well and needs a little extra effort to get his attention to go outside and he loves to be outside exploring in the sunshine.

pet.name: Sheia
pet.shortDesc: Wise lady full of love and kind
pet.description: Sheia is great with kids, cats and dogs, leash, house and crate trained. Sheia is very friendly and loves to cuddle and sleep in bed with you! She is a whiner at times when she wants something, loves going on car rides. We are told she responds better to females, but she has been fine with the male workers here at the shelter. Sheia would not do well in an apartment setting.

pet.name: Mitch
pet.description: Toby is sweet young boy available to an active home who will work on training and confidence building with him. He walks well on leash and does well with potty training but is still a baby so an occasional accident may happen from time to time. He is good with other dogs and happily meets other dogs. A home without small children is best due to his breed and herding instincts. He always seems to be smiling and doing okay on leash training. Toby is already fully vetted and ready for his new home.

pet.name: Sheia
pet.description: This girl has never met a stranger, has never had a bad day and truly embraces squeezing the most fun out of every day! She needs an active household that is willing to work with her on training and manners because we think she is going to be a med/big girl who is full of energy! She would be a great running partner....the sedentary life is not for her. She does like to snuggle and will go completely limp like a noodle in your arms or snuggled under your chin.

pet.name: Darcy
pet.shortDesc: Polite and the most lovable friend
pet.description: Darcy is proving to be the perfect house guest - polite, quiet, affectionate, obedient, and playful, and so lovable! On her sleepovers, she greets her new human friends with a bundle of kisses, and then hangs out with them for cuddles and petting. Then she'll love to run around and play herself silly with puzzle toys. This super social girl asks a lot of questions, sitting in front of you and gazing at you with her inquisitive eyes until you find her a toy. Whatever bed she's offered she'll treat as her home base, hanging out there, napping and playing on it. Then she's an adventurous girl who likes to sniff and explore the yard, wiggling around on her back.  Come meet this well-mannered girl, she'll give you kisses and follow you home.

pet.name: Winnie
pet.description: Whatever bed Winnie’s offered she'll treat as her home base, hanging out there, napping and playing on it. Then she's an adventurous girl who likes to sniff and explore the yard, wiggling around on her back. She's a smart, treat-motivated lady who is an easy-peasy leash walker. She already understands 'sit' and won't jump on furniture until invited to. A house-trained girl, she knows to ask to go outside, and she's readily entered a crate. And she'll ride in a car like it's her job! With her snaggly smile, Tessa should fit well in most homes. She plays well with other dogs and would enjoy a playful cuddle mate. She can be a bit mouthy, so should do best with older kids. Come meet this well-mannered girl, she'll give you kisses and follow you home.

pet.name: Rowan
pet.description: This sweet fellow was caught in a trap by animal control and was taken to a shelter. One if our southern fosters met him and fell in love. Rowan is very timid but is learning to trust his foster mom. He is learning leash manners and actually enjoys getting out for walks. He gets along with the other foster dogs but he's not so sure about the cats in his foster home. Rowan will require a lot of love and patience and must be on a leash when outside as he gets startled easily. He has become vocal and lets his foster mom know when he wants a treat or wants to go for a walk. He would do well in a quiet home without a lot of visitors.

pet.name: Yolo
pet.shortDesc: The sweetest dog who loves to cuddle and play fetch
pet.description: Yolo is an energetic and cuddly, athletic and happy dog that enjoys paddle boarding and swimming, running around and any other forms of activity. He is a great nap partner and activity partner alike. Yolo likes riding in the car, but not so much getting shots. Yolo is very strong. He needs training to walk nicely on leash. He jumps up on people out of excitement, Teens great dog manners will be best due to Yolo's size and jumping. This good boy loves to play with other big dogs, but can overwhelm a small dog and he has not lived with cats, so no cats or small dogs. Yolo was living a sad life until his rescuers saved him and taught him love, paddle boarding, napping and the good life. Because they live in a studio with no yard, they want to find a great home in which Yolo has plenty of room to run as well as people to love, protect and show him fun forever.

pet.name: Booker
pet.shortDesc: Very handsome, smart and loving boy
pet.description: Booker is crate trained, house broken, has house manners, sleeps through the night, enjoys his walks and rides perfectly in the car! With all of that, what else can I say about Booker? He loves his people! Booker would do perfectly with someone who works from home. He is currently in a foster home with two huskies and he is absolutely dog-friendly. Booker would do best in a home where he has a canine friend, preferably a confident female. Booker is a low energy lab, but he does get excited when he knows we are going for a walk or a ride in the car, but he is easily calmed. He knows his basic commands too! He is 99.9% PERFECT!

pet.name: Margo
pet.description: A cute fluffy cat that loves eating and sleeping for 21 hours

pet.name: Miki
pet.description: Sweet kitten, 1 month old, waiting for its new friends...

pet.name: Frozi
pet.description: Lollypop Farm Spirit Cats are like little ninjas in the night. You catch a glimpse of them and then quickly they dart out of view. Why are they like this? We don't always know what a cat's life was like before they were brought to the shelter. They may have had difficult or limited experiences with people. Whatever the reason, some cats are fearful and in need of a special family.

pet.name: Silky
pet.description: Real friend, 1.5 year old cat

pet.name: Spotty
pet.shortDesc: Sweet one month old 3 color kitten
pet.description: Real friend, 1.5 year old cat

pet.name: Blessy
pet.description: A cute fluffy cat that loves eating and sleeping for 21 hours

pet.name: Sam
pet.description: A cute fluffy cat that loves eating and sleeping for 21 hours
